channel.title: Building a Computer
channel.description:
I'm more on the software side of computers. I know nothing about hardware (Well, very little), but I've decided to want to build my own computer. Theres plenty of tutorials on doing it, some are very indepth.
Basically I'm building it for video editing, graphic design, image editing, gaming, and the other average computer things (Intranets, Word Processing, all the basics).
So when you see what I've chosen as a base, if you laugh, you'll know why.
PC Case - Apevia X-Discovery Computer Case - Black - $62.99
[img]http://lib.store.yahoo.net/lib/xoxide/aspire-x-disc-blk-2.jpg[/img] [url=http://www.xoxide.com/aspire-x-discovery-black.html]Click Here[/url]

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Where are you getting these computer prices from? They are all insanely too expensive. Try newegg.com or tigerdirect.com

item.dc:creator: @Monkey_wacko Monkey wacko
item.description:

I realize some things are missing here

To clear it up:

I’m getting a 250 GB hard drive

Looking for 2 GB of RAM (Not really sure what hardware I’m looking for, I’ve never searched for these things before)

Operating systems are Windows XP Media Edition with an Ubuntu (Possibly Ku/Xu) Dual Boot[/quote]

get a 300gb hard drive then get windows xp pro then dual boot xp media and ubuntu dosn’t work…

item.title: Building a Computer
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

Processors are not that expensive normally and I don’t see what .Flair spelled wrong so leave him alone. -.-

Here’s some you can go thru, .Flair: http://www.newegg.com/Product/ProductList.aspx?Submit=ENE&N=2+50001157+40000343+1050722265&name=Core+2+Duo.

item.title: Building a Computer
item.dc:creator: @Monkey_wacko Monkey wacko
item.description:
@Monkey_wacko wrote:

1st: learn to spell
2nd: Intel® Xeon® Processor 7000 Sequence Xeon is for servers, and Processors cost about 450-600 bucks each!
3rd: the fan will be about 50+ bucks
4th: your video card will be about 150 bucks…

Read full topic

item.title: Building a Computer
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

You don’t need a floppy disc drive. Floppy’s are obsolete. Also, you neglected to post how much RAM you actually have and how big the hard drive actually is. As for the processor, take a look at an Intel Dual-Core processor, they have quite a few good ones.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a Computer
item.dc:creator: @LegendaryLoser .Flair
item.description:
@LegendaryLoser wrote:

Meh, I may skip the floppy drive

I need a good processor, that was just a guess because I couldn’t find the actual price.

Read full topic
